intro: Galium karliovaense, commonly known as Karlovian bedstraw, is a perennial herb native to Central Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems that often root at the nodes. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming from June to August. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Galium karliovaense thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
